    • Field Detail

      • doLogging

        private static final boolean doLogging
        set doLogging to false to turn off logging completely.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • selectiveLogging

        private static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> selectiveLogging
        You can add here names of loggers which shall be enabled. Loggers which are not listed are disabled. BUT: If the array is empty all loggers are enabled.

      • defaultLogLevel

        private static final java.util.logging.Level defaultLogLevel
        set the log level for loggers that have no specific log level defined

      • logLevelMap

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.logging.Level> logLevelMap
        Here you can specify the log level of a logger. add log levels for any loggers, alternatively you can specify log level of a logger which has the same name as a class directly in a field of type Level in the class

      • getLogger

        public static java.util.logging.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Find or create a logger for a named subsystem. If a logger has already been created with the given name it is returned. Otherwise a new logger is created.
        Parameters:
        name - A name for the logger. This should be a dot-separated name and should normally be based on the package name or class name of the subsystem, such as java.net or javax.swing
        Returns:
        a suitable Logger

        private static java.io.File initLogging()
